pr_title: Fix syntax error on SKIP directives

timeline.message: fix: Fix syntax error on SKIP directives #630

timeline.bodyText: Here I expect that line with PROGRAM-ID will be skipped. So that means that here will be an error on DATA DIVISION line: "Syntax error on 'DATA' expected PROGRAM_ID".
timeline.author: grianbrcom
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@

+package com.broadcom.lsp.cobol.usecases;
+
+import com.broadcom.lsp.cobol.service.CopybookProcessingMode;
+import com.broadcom.lsp.cobol.usecases.engine.UseCaseEngine;
+import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
+
+import java.util.List;
+import java.util.Map;
+
+/**
+ * This test checks that SKIP1, SKIP2 and SKIP3 are allowed everywhere and do not produce syntax
+ * errors.
+ */
+class TestSkipStatementsAllowedEverywhere {
+  private static final String TEXT =
+      "        IDENTIFICATION DIVISION.\n"
+          + "        SKIP1\n"
+          + "        PROGRAM-ID. TEST1.\n"

replies.bodyText: The SKIP1, SKIP2, and SKIP3 statements specify blank lines that the compiler should add when printing the source listing. SKIP statements have no effect on the compilation of the source text itself.
replies.author: temanbrcom
